summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 18, 2019, discussing the status of Digital Video Recorders (DVRs) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) where Jeffrey Epstein was held. It reports that DVR1 is functional and video is viewable, while DVR2 experienced a hard disk failure around July 29, 2019, and data from August (the period of Epstein's death) will not exist on it.

events.title: DVR2 Hard Disk Failure
events.description: DVR2 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center stopped recording due to a hard disk failure.

events.title: Vendor Contacted for DVR Support
events.description: The vendor, SigNet, was contacted for support regarding DVR2's failure, which was noticed in early August.

events.title: DVR1 Configured and Reviewable
events.description: With assistance from vendor SigNet, DVR1 at MCC was configured and made operational, allowing video to be viewed and prepared for upload to TTK for review.

keyFacts: DVR1 from the Metropolitan Correctional Center was successfully configured and made reviewable on September 18, 2019, with video to be uploaded for analysis.
DVR2 experienced a hard disk failure around July 29, 2019, and was not fixed before FBI custody; thus, it contains no video data from August 2019.
The failure of DVR2 went unnoticed until early August 2019, when the vendor SigNet was contacted for support.
Data on DVR2 is believed to exist from approximately July 14/15 to July 29, 2019, but this is unconfirmed and recovery would be time-intensive with no guarantee of success.
The email chain involves FBI personnel from the Digital Forensic Analysis Unit and Operational Technology Division discussing the technical status of MCC surveillance systems.
